title: Face Palm

nouns: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.
Doubt, a status between belief and disbelief, involves uncertainty or distrust or lack of sureness of an alleged fact, an action, a motive, or a decision.
Doubt is uncertainty in the context of trust, action, decision or belief.
The state of being unsure of something
A status between belief and disbelief, involves uncertainty or distrust or lack of sureness of an alleged fact, an action, a motive, or a decision
Challenge about the truth or accuracy of a matter.
The state of being dubious.
Uncertainty, disbelief.
The inner surface of the hand from the wrist to the base of the fingers
The thenar eminence refers to the group of muscles on the palm of the human hand at the base of the thumb.
The inner and somewhat concave part of the human hand that extends from the wrist to the bases of the fingers.
Inner, concave part of hand.
Most fleshy portion of the palm of the human hand, located adjacent to the second joint of the thumb
The palm of the hand or sole of the foot
A state of physical and/or mental weakness and a lack of vigor.
Fatigue is a subjective feeling of tiredness which is distinct from weakness, and has a gradual onset.
Exhaustion, fatigue or tiredness
A weariness caused by exertion; exhaustion.
Tiredness; fatigue
Temporary loss of strength and energy resulting from hard physical or mental work
Range of afflictions, usually associated with physical and/or mental weakness
Any one of several other medical conditions that cause lethargy
Exhaustion, fatigue or tiredness.
The state of being tired.

description:
A hand shown pressing against the head of a person, commonly written as facepalm. Used to display frustration or embarrassment at the ineptitude of a person or situation.

May be used in a similar context to the acronym SMH (shaking my head), or in relation to the Picard Facepalm meme.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the facepalming emoji depicts a stylized figure bringing their palm to their forehead with a pronounced sense of exasperation. The generous 3D shading and soft, rounded edges on Appleâ€™s rendering emphasize the gestureâ€™s universally understood meaning of disbelief or utter defeat. This emoji on Apple devices is perfect for conveying moments of embarrassment, frustration, or when something has gone hilariously wrong.
